intro: Neraudia angulata var. angulata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf neraudia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Arecaceae. It is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves that are typically arranged in a fan shape. The plant produces small, clustered inflorescences with yellowish-white flowers. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in warm climates for its unique foliage.
